eventsAnnotated.name: 2019 Alberta wildfires (500) A
eventsAnnotated.description: The 2019 Alberta wildfires were described by NASA as part of an extreme fire season in the province. From March 1, when the wildfire season begins, until May 31, there had been an historic level of hectares burned 496,739.19 or 4,967.4 km2 (1,227,500 acres), which is over 3.5 times more land burned that in the five-year average amount of hectares burned. <a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Alberta_wildfires' target='_blank'>Wikipedia Page<a>

eventsAnnotated.name: 2019 STEM School Highlands Ranch Shooting (500) A
eventsAnnotated.description: On May 7, 2019, a school shooting occurred at STEM School Highlands Ranch, a charter school located in Douglas County, Colorado, United States, in the Denver suburb of Highlands Ranch. One student was killed and eight others were injured. <a href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/STEM_School_Highlands_Ranch_shooting' target='_blank'>Wikipedia Page<a>
